Every year and worse the walls of the medieval town of Rhodes

06 Nov 2019, 19:55


Cracks and problematic spots on the walls of the Medieval City are becoming bigger and bigger.

Thousands of our fellow citizens have had the opportunity to see this year (in the course of the Rhodes for Life event held through the moat) that the situation has worsened.
Are those in charge of static control (inside and outside the walls) concerned with the situation? And if so, when do they expect to intervene?
When will they start to collapse?
